alert.note: Alert for Runnels; Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 10:19PM CDT until May 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coke, Runnels and Sterling. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robert Lee, Maverick, Bronte, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Sanco, Silver, Tennyson, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059 and The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Mule Creek Road crossing Mule Creek, Poverty Canyon crossing Mule Creek, Saynor crossing Mule Creek, Juniper Road crossing just east of Highway 277, Juniper crossing Juniper Creek, Ratliff crossing just east of Highway 277, Graham Valley crossing, Fields crossing, Collier crossing and Hurley crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
